page.title: 02AMENITIES IN PLAISH AREA
page.content: Modern amenities that are taken so much for granted in populated areas, are not easy of access in this part of Shropshire.A car is an absolute necessity to the inhabitants of the hamlets and isolated farmhouses.There is only one bus a week to Shrewsbury, it travels through the countryside on a Tuesday morning,picking up passengers at gateways and turnings, dropping them off again in the afternoon,their only link with civilisation_if a link is needed and this is debatable. Shops,doctors, clinic,dentist,Post Office,Banks are all 8 miles away in Church Stretton. The Church is at Cardington,5 miles distant and the Junior School is about 3 miles.The travelling Library calls every 2 weeks,but there is no travelling shop as in some parts.
